alert.note: Alert for Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued September 19 at 10:20AM PDT until September 20 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE LNU LIGHTNING COMPLEX BURN SCAR IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the LNU Lightning Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following area, Southern Sacramento Valley. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy rainfall over the LNU Lightning Complex burn scar is expected this afternoon into this evening. Residents near the Hennessey Fire in the LNU Lightning Complex Burn Scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Hennessey Fire in the LNU Lightning Complex Burn Scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
